subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] nuff said?

And I have a ton more research to verify that=C2=A0to be a fact.=C2=A0 The =
human brain is hard wired to naturally make sense out of random pictures, s=
ounds and events.

It is just the way we are made.=C2=A0 And that is why it=
 is paramount we all look at such things with a discerning eye.

=C2=A0"Nat=
ure is showing us only the tail of the lion, but I have no doubt that the l=
ion belongs to it even though, because of its large size, it cannot totally=
 reveal itself all at once." 
-=E2=80=94 Albert Einstein 


"It is far bett=
er to grasp the universe as it really is than to persist in delusions, howe=
ver satisfying and reassuring."
--Carl Sagan


"There is no such thing as a=
n insignificant detail. Don't just look 
for what you want to find."
-- Me =
LOL 




________________________________
From: April Abercrombie <april@ab=
ercrombieghostresearch.com>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Fri, April 23=
, 2010 5:30:25 PM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] nuff said?

=C2=A0 
Pareidolia is =
not psuedo science. It is an actual, proven, natural functioning of the bra=
in.

http://en.wikipedia .org/wiki/ Pareidolia

Please read this article, a=
nd more, if you have any questions about it being psuedo science. I chose t=
he Wikipedia version because I thought it would be the least offensive to y=
ou. Other articles specifically called out EVP and other things.

For the r=
ecord, I don't think all EVP's are due to pareidolia.



On Fri, Apr 23, 20=
10 at 3:47 PM, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@ gmail.com> wrote:

=C2=A0 
=
>=C2=A0It was implied that all this stuff is "Pareidolia", and because you =
could put a name on it that somehow meant it was all explanined. I've been =
hearing this pseudo scientific BS for 10 years, so I'm a bit touchy. Scienc=
e explains the paranormal away, and yet people continune to photograph imag=
es, and get their names, and the names of deseased loved ones through EVP, =
as well as questions answered, and science(althogh not all scientists)=C2=
=A0just ignores these inconvinient facts and focuses on=C2=A0that we=C2=A0m=
ight see things that are not there, which I disagree with as well. 
>
>=C2=
=A0Did you even bother looking at the image on the group home page. That wa=
s from sweeping a TV tuner with a random voltage and video recording the mo=
nitor screen. So explain away why there is a wolf image embedded in the guy=
's hat, an image of an alien below his ear, and why in God's name does he r=
esembles the classic description=C2=A0of an MIB or=C2=A0Shadow Person?=C2=
=A0 Pareidolia no doubt!
>
>=C2=A0F-S
>
>
>On Fri, Apr 23, 2010 at 3:19 PM,=
 Rj <rasterer@yahoo. com> wrote:
>
>=C2=A0 
>>I'm not sure who you're talki=
ng to about "holier than thou".=C2=A0 But, you are the one who keeps dismis=
sing any question about results and testing with phrases like "Bite Me". I =
don't see anyone else doing that, and I certainly never have.
>>
>>I agree =
trying new things is good.=C2=A0 And discussing results.=C2=A0 And looking =
for new directions.=C2=A0=C2=A0 So I'm still not sure who you are upset wit=
h.=C2=A0 Perhaps you could be more specific: quote what you have found obje=
ctionable, and let us know why?
>>
>>
>>
>>--- On Fri, 4/23/10, Frank Sumpt=
ion <purplealiengirl@ gmail.com> wrote:
>>
>>

epdorks, make my day!=C2=A0=C2=A0I don't mind some honest debate, but not t=
his holier than thou science BS, where you think cuz you stick a label on s=
omething=C2=A0it can be dismissed as thoroughly debunked. Maybe--I'm easily=
 offended, and I'll take that into account. 
>>>
>>>=C2=A0F-S
